creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: graceful, bow-shaped figure with flat bottom, and organic, gently twisting curves; pointed ends, one wider than the other; black lacquer
marks: Signature on bottom, near wider end, in black, unidentified
text: Murata Yoshihiko creates his small and delicate silhouettes from maple wood. Receiving inspiration from nature, he says: “I simulate three-dimensional shapes in my mind, for example, how lines will be flowing or how they are placed on pedestals or attached to walls. I believe that only lines that look beautiful from any angle can make a lithe and sharp silhouette.”
title: Barrier: Sleeping Mountain
